channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-21535] UnalignedCheckpointITCase.execute failed with "OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"

item.summary: UnalignedCheckpointITCase.execute failed with "OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: cc AHeise pnowojski Could you take a look at the issue?
The one Matthias posted is actually not a UC failure, it's a failure from a test I introduced.
Not sure whether I understand: The UnalignedCheckpointICase is actually failing due to a OOM in the build. ...independent of the build timing out. Or do I miss something here?

Oh, yes, you are right. I was mislead by the stacktraces printed at the bottom of the log output, where {{ at org.apache.flink.test.scheduling.ReactiveModeITCase.testScaleUpOnAdditionalTaskManager(ReactiveModeITCase.java:104)
}} was failing.
Then ignore my comment.

Afaik Arvid has debugged some memory leak in that test.

A quick assessment of the 3 cases: the test is just running too long and some test implementations that track all records are running OOM. The root cause however is rather that the test take >10 min when they should finish <<1min. I'll investigate further.

Quite possible that FLINK-21689 is a duplicate.
I verified that FLINK-21540, FLINK-21599, and FLINK-21689 are duplicates and closed them as such. It's also "only" a test issue. Fix for test coming today.

Enabling the tests for the AdaptiveScheduler (see FLINK-34409):

    • 96142404c143f2094af262b8ac02a8b06aa773d5
  • 1.19
    • 7d107966dbe7e38e43680fabf3ffdfeaa71e8d3c

    • 836b332b2d100e21b1d0008257a009d9ec09e13a
